title: ABS Modulator Electrical Connector Disconnect/Reconnect and Pin Numbering

body.body: ABS Modulator Electrical Connector Disconnect/Reconnect and Pin Numbering
Disconnection of the ABS ECM Connector
When disconnecting a connector, never pull directly on the wires as this may result in cable and connector damage.
Never disconnect an ECM when the ignition switch is in the ON position as this may cause multiple fault codes to be logged in the ECM memory.
Always disconnect an ECM after disconnecting the battery negative (black) lead first.
Turn the ignition to the OFF position and wait at least 1 minute for the engine ECM to complete its power down sequence.
ABS Modulator Disconnect and Connect DR5 DS5 H*8 PB1 PJ1 PM1 PR1 PS1, L*1
Press the locking device and move the lever to the rear of the connector while disconnecting it from the ABS ECM.
When disconnected, make sure the lever is fully to the rear of the connector. An audible click can be heard when it is locked in position.

body.name: Electrical Connectors - ABS ECM Connector - NN3_NN4 (L0065)

body.body: Reconnection of the ABS ECM Connector
Damage to the connector pins may result if an attempt to fit the connectors incorrectly is made.
If the lever is not fully over to the rear position, it is possible that the connector may not fully engage into its socket.
Make sure the lever on the connector is fully over to the unlocked position, as shown below:
Align the connector to its socket on the ABS modulator such that the end of the lever aligns with the lug on the socket.

Release the lever by pushing it towards the front of the connector. At the same time, push the connector into its socket until the lever is fully forward and locked in position. An audible click can be heard when locked.

body.name: Electrical Connectors - ABS ECM Connector - NN3_NN4 (L0065)

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DS5; DR5; HL8; HK8; HJ8; HG8; PS1; PR1; PM1; LL1; LG1; PJ1; PB1

body.body: ABS Modulator ECM Connector Pin Numbering
ABS ECM connector pin numbering fragment
The illustration below shows the pin numbering system used in the Pinpoint Tests - ABS ECM.
ABS Modulator ECM Connector has 18 pins
As viewed on the mating face with the ECM (as per the illustration), pins are numbered from right to left with number one in the top right corner.
